Old Center Schoolhouse
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Fellows, Lyman [work]

mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: According to the Canterbury Historical Society’s brochure, “Lyman Fellows built the Center School in 1844 at the age of 19." Fellows was a resident of Canterbury. After serving as a school, a museum, and the home of the local historical society, it has been reinvented as a school and a “living example of what education in a one-room schoolhouse was like in the early part of the 20th century.” http://csaa.typepad.com/country_school_associatio/2009/10/the-center-school-in-canterbury-nh-may-be-the-last--remaining-schoolhouses-in-town-but-it-is-first-in-the-hearts-of-tho.html [work]
